{{Orphan|date=August 2012}}
{{Infobox company |name=LucidEra |logo=<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:lucidera-logo.gif]] --> |type=Private |foundation=[[California]] 2005 |location=[[San Mateo, California]] |industry=On-demand software }}
'''LucidEra''' was an on-demand (aka [[Software as a service|SaaS]]) [[business intelligence]] (BI) solution provider. On June 22, 2009, it was announced that LucidEra would cease operations by the end of June 2009.<ref name="Kelly">{{cite web |url=http://searchdatamanagement.techtarget.com/news/article/0,289142,sid91_gci1359897,00.html |title=SaaS BI vendor LucidEra to shut down |publisher=TechTarget |first=Jeff |last=Kelly |date=2009-06-22 |accessdate=2009-06-23}}</ref>
== History == LucidEra was founded in 2005 by Ken Rudin, John Sichi, and Tai Tran.<ref name="Foundation">{{cite web |url=http://www.eigenbase.org/foundation.html |title=Foundation |publisher=The Eigenbase Project |accessdate=2008-01-31 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lucidera.com/company/executive_team.php |title=Executive Team |publisher=LucidEra |accessdate=2008-01-31 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080204075754/http://www.lucidera.com/company/executive_team.php#tina |archive-date=2008-02-04 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> Series A funding was led by [[Benchmark Capital]] and Matrix Partners. In 2007, LucidEra secured Series B funding led by Crosslink Capital.
The company's CEO, Ken Rudin, summarizes the vision: "Our ultimate goal is to be to BI what salesforce.com is to CRM and all kinds of transaction applications."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blogs.zdnet.com/BTL/?p=4598 |first=Dan |last=Farber |title=LucidEra opens for business intelligence on demand |work=ZDNet |publisher=CNET Networks |date=2007-03-06 |accessdate=2008-01-31 }}</ref> ([[Salesforce.com]] being a well-known SaaS company).
LucidEra was a privately held company headquartered in [[San Mateo, California]]. LucidEra ceased operations in June 2009.<ref name="Kelly"/> [[Birst]], and [[GoodData]] are offering safe harbor programs for LucidEra customers.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.birst.com/about/press/06-23-lucidera.shtml |title=Birst Offers "Quick Switch" Program for LucidEra Customers |publisher=Birst |date=2009-06-23 |accessdate=2009-06-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gooddata.com/blog/gooddata-offers-safe-harbor-to-lucidera-customers |title=GoodData Offers Safe Harbor to LucidEra Customers |publisher=GoodData |date=2009-06-22 |accessdate=2009-06-23 }}</ref>
== Technology == LucidEra's offering was focused on analytics of CRM and ERP data. However, the analytics applications were not special-purpose built, rather LucidEra developed a generic BI platform, upon which it built vertical solutions.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://due-diligence.typepad.com/blog/2007/05/low_rent_etl_an.html |first=Tim |last=Oren |title=Low Rent ETL and Analytics |work=Tim Oren's Due Diligence |date=2007-05-25 |accessdate=2008-01-31 }}</ref>
The company's technology was reliant on open source software such as [[JBoss application server|JBoss]],<ref>[https://archive.is/20110710064535/http://forums.bea.com/thread.jspa?threadID=600018569 jrockit dump in clsIsBeingUnloaded in JRockit Newsgroups in Newsgroups<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[Dojo Toolkit]],<ref>[http://dojotoolkit.org/pipermail/dojo-interest/2006-April/006838.html [Dojo-interest] Dynamically loading dojo elements<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070221203341/http://dojotoolkit.org/pipermail/dojo-interest/2006-April/006838.html |date=2007-02-21 }}</ref> [[Mondrian OLAP server|Mondrian]],<ref>[http://lists.pentaho.org/pipermail/mondrian/2007-March/000220.html [Mondrian] Util.lookupCompound MatchType BEFORE<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and software from the Eigenbase Foundation.<ref>[http://www.luciddb.org/projectFaq.html LucidDB Project FAQ<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> LucidEra is a key contributor to the [[LucidDB]] project, which is hosted by the Eigenbase Foundation. Two of the founders of LucidEra, John Sichi and Tai Tran, are also executives of the Eigenbase Foundation.<ref name="Foundation" />
Much of the BI technology, particularly the ETL, [[metadata]], and [[Column-oriented DBMS]] technology, was based on source code acquired from Broadbase, and was extensively adapted to a modern SaaS architecture.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://esj.com/business_intelligence/article.aspx?EditorialsID=8343 |first=Stephen |last=Swoyer |title=LucidEra Touts Rip-and-Don’t-Replace Outsourced BI |work=Enterprise Systems |publisher=1105 Media |date=2007-03-07 |accessdate=2008-01-31 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071012100702/http://esj.com/business_intelligence/article.aspx?EditorialsID=8343 |archivedate=2007-10-12 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
== Products == LucidEra launched its first offering, the forecast to billing application, in March 2007.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ebizq.net/blogs/column2/archives/2007/03/lucidera_launch_1.php |first=Sandy |last=Kemsley |title=LucidEra launches today |work=Column 2 |publisher=ebizQ |date=2007-03-06 |accessdate=2008-01-31 }}</ref>
LucidSnapShots was released summer of 2007.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.intelligententerprise.com/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=201201217 |first=Antone |last=Gonsalves |date=July 25, 2007 |title=LucidEra Unveils New Tools For On-Demand Forecast-To-Billing Application |work=Intelligent Enterprise |publisher=CMP Media |accessdate=2008-01-31 }}</ref>
In the fall of 2007, LucidEra announced availability of Revenue Lifecycle Analysis and Sales Analysis on Salesforce.com's AppExchange.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m0EIN/is_2007_Sept_17/ai_n19521183 |title=LucidEra Sales Analysis Now Available on Salesforce.com's AppExchange |work=Business Wire |date=2007-09-17 |publisher=CNET Networks |accessdate=2008-01-31 }}</ref>
== Competitors ==
=== Traditional BI companies ===
Other BI companies which can be classified as traditional software vendors include: * [[BusinessObjects]] (acquired by SAP in October, 2007) * [[Cognos]] (acquired by IBM in November, 2007) * [[MicroStrategy]] * [[SAS Institute Inc.|SAS]] * [[Information Builders]]
=== SaaS BI companies ===
Other BI companies which also have a SaaS business model include: * [[Birst]] * Cloud9 Charts * [[Data Applied]] * FunnelSource, Inc.<ref>[http://www.funnelsource.com/ FunnelSource, Inc.]</ref> * [[GoodData]] * Indicee<ref>[http://www.indicee.com Indicee] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100213083300/http://www.indicee.com/ |date=2010-02-13 }}</ref> * [[Jaspersoft#Jaspersoft|Jaspersoft]] * Litebi * Oco * PivotLink<ref>[http://www.pivotlink.com PivotLink]</ref> (Formerly SeaTab) * [[RJMetrics]] * [[Scoremind]] * [[Sisense]] * [[Zoho Office Suite#Zoho Reports|Zoho Reports]]

Neil Trophy|BWAA Fighter of the Year]], winning the award in 2006, 2008, and 2009; and the [[Best Fighter ESPY Award]] in 2009 and 2011.{{cite news | title = Pacquiao named fighter of the decade | work = [[Reuters]] | date = June 5, 2010 | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE6541BX20100605 | first=Alastair | last=Himmer}} Pacquiao has generated approximately 19.2 million in [[pay-per-view]] buys and $1.2 billion in revenue from his 23 pay-per-view bouts.{{cite web|author=Kurt Badenhausen|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/kurtbadenhausen/2016/04/09/manny-pacquiao-set-to-retire-with-500-million-in-career-earnings/#5f4ff5866f25|title=Manny Pacquiao Set To Retire After Bradley Fight With $500 Million In Career Earnings|publisher=Forbes|date=April 9, 2015}} According to ''[[Forbes' list of world's highest-paid athletes|Forbes]]'', he was the second highest paid athlete in the world as of 2015.[https://www.forbes.com/athletes/list/ The World's Highest-Paid Athletes]. Forbes.com (2013–06). Retrieved on February 22, 2014. Beyond boxing, Pacquiao has participated in basketball, business, TV hosting, acting, music recording, and politics. In May 2010, Pacquiao [[Philippine House of Representatives elections in SOCCSKSARGEN, 2010#Sarangani|was elected]] to the [[House of Representatives of the Philippines|House of Representatives]] in the [[15th Congress of the Philippines]], representing the province of [[Sarangani]]. He was re-elected in 2013 to the [[16th Congress of the Philippines]].{{cite web |url=http://boxing.fanhouse.com/2010/05/10/manny-pacquiao-declares-landslide-congressional-victory-in-phi/?sms_ss=twitter |title=Manny Pacquiao Declares 'Landslide' Congressional Win in Philippines |author=Nancy Gay | date=May 10, 2010 |work=Boxing Fanhouse |accessdate =May 11, 2010}} In June 2016, Pacquiao was elected as a senator and will serve a six-year term until 2022.{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/boxing/story/_/id/15604309/boxing-great-manny-pacquiao-wins-senate-seat-philippines|date=May 20, 2016|title=Manny Pacquiao wins senate seat|work=ESPN|accessdate=July 25, 2016}} Pacquiao has been considered a top contender for [[Philippine presidential election, 2022]]. Incumbent president [[Rodrigo Duterte]] announced in December 2016 and December 2017 that he intends to make Pacquiao his successor.http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/12/18/17/duterte-wants-to-make-pacquiao-president ==Early and personal life== Pacquiao was born on December 17, 1978, in [[Kibawe, Bukidnon|Kibawe]], [[Bukidnon]], [[Philippines]]. He is the son of Rosalio Pacquiao and Dionisia Dapidran-Pacquiao.{{cite web |url=http://www.doghouseboxing.com/DHB/Robert111009.htm |title=Manny Pacquiao's Mom and Dad Reunited? |author=Robbie Pangilinan |date=November 9, 2009 |work=Doghouse Boxing |accessdate=March 15, 2010}} His parents separated when he was in sixth grade, after his mother discovered that his father was living with another woman. He is the fourth among six siblings: Liza Silvestre-Onding and Domingo Silvestre (from first husband of his mother) and Isidra Pacquiao-Paglinawan, [[Bobby Pacquiao|Alberto "Bobby" Pacquiao]] and Rogelio "Roel" Pacquiao. Pacquiao married [[Jinkee Pacquiao|Jinkee Jamora]] on May 10, 2000. Together, they have five children, Emmanuel Jr. (Jimuel), Michael Stephen, Mary Divine Grace, Queen Elizabeth and Israel. His daughter, Queen, was born in the United States. He resides in his hometown of [[General Santos City]], [[South Cotabato]], Philippines.{{cite web|url=http://www.canadastarboxing.com/Fighters/manny-pacquiao-profile.htm |title=canadastarboxing.com, Profile and Bio |publisher=Canadastarboxing.com |date= |accessdate=May 9, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100329104105/http://www.canadastarboxing.com/Fighters/manny-pacquiao-profile.htm |archivedate=March 29, 2010 }} However, as a congressman of lone district of Sarangani, he is officially residing in [[Kiamba, Sarangani]], the hometown of his wife. Raised in the [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]] faith,{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/othersports/boxingandmma/5243745/Boxer-Manny-Pacquiao-looks-beyond-the-ring-to-politics-after-Ricky-Hatton-fight.html | work=The Daily Telegraph | location=London practicing [[Evangelicalism|Evangelical Protestant]].{{cite web |url=http://deadspin.com/5967285/manny-pacquiaos-mom-thinks-he-lost-because-hes-no-longer-a-catholic |title=Manny Pacquiao's Mom Thinks |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/329938/sports/basketball/nba-lin-supports-pacquiao-s-newfound-faith-hopes-for-howard-s-integration-in-houston |title=Jeremy Lin Supports Boxer Manny Voice|last=Ellis|first=Mark|date=April 30, 2015|work=[[Charisma News]]|accessdate=July 10, 2016}} ==Education== Pacquiao completed his elementary education at Saavedra Saway Elementary School in General Santos City, but dropped out of high school due to extreme poverty.{{cite news |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1935091,00.html |title=The Meaning and Mythos of Manny Pacquiao |author=Howard Chua-Eoan and Ishaan Tharoor |date=November 16, 2009 |work=Time.com |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |accessdate=March 15, 2010}} He left his home at age 14 because his mother, who had six children, was not making enough money to support her family. In February 2007 he took, and passed, [[Alternative Learning System (Philippines)|a high school equivalency exam]], making him eligible for college education.{{cite web |url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/sports/view/20070222-51049/Pacquiao_%91graduates%92_from_high_school |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130223040618/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/sports/view/20070222-51049/Pacquiao_%91graduates%92_from_high_school |dead-url=yes |archive-date=February 23, 2013 |title=Pacquiao 'graduates' from high school |author=Jerry E. Esplanada |date=February 22, 2007 |work=Inquirer.net |publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]] |accessdate=March 15, 2010}} He was awarded with a high school diploma by the [[Department of Education (Philippines)|Department of Education]]. Pacquiao enrolled for a college degree in business management at [[Notre Dame of Dadiangas University]] (NDDU) in his aforementioned hometown of General Santos City. On February 18, 2009, Pacquiao was conferred the Honorary Degree of Doctor of Humanities (Honoris Causa) by [[Southwestern University (Philippines)|Southwestern University]] (SWU) at the [[Waterfront Cebu City Hotel & Casino]] in Lahug, [[Cebu City]] in recognition of his boxing achievements and humanitarian work.{{cite web |url=http://swugradschool.com/publication/102 |title=Pacman: new GS alumnus |author= |date= |work=SWU Publications |publisher=[[Southwestern University (Philippines)|Southwestern University]] |accessdate=March 14, 2010}} In preparation for his career as a lawmaker in the House of Representatives, Pacquiao enrolled in the Certificate Course in Development, Legislation and Governance at the Development Academy of the Philippines – Graduate School of Public and Development Management (DAP-GSPDM).{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/regions/06/15/10/pacquiao-starts-course-how-be-good-congressman |title=Pacquiao starts course on how to be a good congressman |publisher=Abs-cbnnews.com |date=June 16, 2010 |accessdate=August 10, 2011}} ==Military== Pacquiao is a [[military reserve|military reservist]] with the rank of [[Colonel]] in the Reserve Force of the [[Philippine Army]].{{cite news| url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/lifestyle/content/636094/manny-pacquiao-is-promoted-to-a-full-colonel/story/ | work=GMA News Online | title=Manny Pacquiao is promoted to full colonel | first=Janine Anne | last=Bigtas | date=December 11, 2017 | accessdate=July 15, 2018}} Prior to being promoted to full Colonel after finishing his General Staff Course (GSC) schooling, he held the rank of Lieutenant Colonel for being a member of the Philippine Congress as per the AFP's regulations for reservist officers. He first entered the Army's reserve force on April 27, 2006 as a [[Sergeant]]. Later, he rose to [[Technical Sergeant]] on December 1 of the same year. On October 7, 2007, he became a [[Master Sergeant]], the highest rank in the enlisted personnel. On May 4, 2009, he was given the special rank of [[Senior Master Sergeant]] and was also designated as the Command Sergeant Major of the 15th Ready Reserve Division.{{cite news| url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/105617/army-promotes-pacquiao-to-lieutenant-colonel | work=Inquirer News | title=Army promotes Pacquiao to lieutenant colonel | first=Matikas | last=Santos | date=December 5, 2011 | accessdate=June 23, 2012}} ==Boxing career== {{summarize|from|Boxing career of Manny Pacquiao|better=y|section=y}} {{Main article|Boxing career of Manny Pacquiao}} [[File:Pacman.jpg|thumb|right|310px|Pacquiao with his coach [[Freddie Roach (boxing)|Freddie Roach]]]] In 2016, Pacquiao was ranked second on ESPN's list of top pound for pound boxers of the past 25 years. He is the only eight-division world champion in the history of the sport, having won eleven major world titles, as well as being the first boxer to win the lineal championship in five different weight classes. Pacquiao is also the first boxer in history to win major world titles in four of the original eight weight classes of boxing, also known as the "glamour divisions": flyweight, featherweight, lightweight, and welterweight.{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/sports/2017-08/15/content_30626532.htm|title=Poverty gave Pacquiao his big push|publisher=China Daily|date=15 August 2017}} He was named Fighter of the Decade for the 2000s by the Boxing Writers Association of America (BWAA), WBC, and WBO. He is also a three-time ''Ring'' magazine and BWAA Fighter of the Year, winning the award in 2006, 2008, and 2009; and the Best Fighter ESPY Award in 2009 and 2011. BoxRec ranks him as the greatest Asian fighter of all time.{{cite web|url=http://boxrec.com/records|title=BoxRec Ratings|publisher=|accessdate=May 2, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170104115343/http://boxrec.com/records|archivedate=January 4, 2017|df=mdy-all}} Pacquiao was long rated as the best active boxer in the world, pound for pound, by most sporting news and boxing websites, including ESPN, ''[[Sports Illustrated]]'', ''[[Sporting Life (British newspaper)|Sporting Life]]'', [[Yahoo! Sports]], [[About.com]], BoxRec, and ''[[The Ring (magazine)|The Ring]]'', beginning from his climb to [[lightweight]] until his losses in 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.ringtv.com/ratings/ |title=The Ring Pound For Pound Ratings |publisher=Ringtv.com |date=August 16, 2010 |accessdate=August 22, 2010}}[http://boxrec.com/ratings.php?country=&sex=m&division=P4P&status=A&SUBMIT=Go Ratings], [http://boxrec.com/ boxrec.com].
[https://web.archive.org/web/20110629213913/http://www.sportinglife.com/boxing/news/story_get.cgi?STORY_NAME=boxing%2F10%2F11%2F22%2Fmanual_212005.html Pacquiao Back on Top] (May 17, 2012), [http://www.sportinglife.com/ sportinglife.com] (archived from [http://www.sportinglife.com/boxing/news/story_get.cgi?STORY_NAME=boxing/10/11/22/manual_212005.html the original] on June 29, 2011). He is also the longest reigning top-ten active boxer on [[The Ring magazine Pound for Pound|''The Ring'''s pound for pound list]] from November 2003 to April 2016.{{cite web|url=http://ringtv.craveonline.com/ratings/pound-for-pound |title=Ring Ratings Pound for Pound |work=Ring TV |date=November 24, 2014 |accessdate=2014-11-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141208215444/http://ringtv.craveonline.com/ratings/pound-for-pound |archivedate=December 8, 2014 |df= }} Over the course of his decorated career, Pacquiao has defeated 20 world champions - [[Chatchai Sasakul]], [[Lehlohonolo Ledwaba]], [[Jorge Eliecer Julio]], [[Marco Antonio Barrera]] (twice), [[Erik Morales]] (twice), [[Oscar Larios]], [[Jorge Solis]], [[Juan Manuel Marquez]] (twice), [[David Díaz (boxer)|David Diaz]], [[Oscar De La Hoya]], [[Ricky Hatton]], [[Miguel Cotto]], [[Joshua Clottey]], [[Antonio Margarito]], [[Shane Mosley]], [[Brandon Rios]], [[Timothy Bradley]] (twice), [[Chris Algieri]], [[Jessie Vargas]] and [[Lucas Matthysse]]. Pacquiao has also generated approximately 19.2 million in pay-per-view buys and $1.2 billion in revenue from his 23 pay-per-view bouts. According to ''Forbes'', he was the second highest paid athlete in the world as of 2015. Pacquiao started boxing at the age of 14 while living in the streets of [[Manila]] and turned professional when he was 16 years old. He had a record of 60-4 as an amateur and currently has a record of 60-7-2 as a professional, with 39 wins by knockout. "Many of you know me as a legendary boxer, and I'm proud of that," he said. "However, that journey was not always easy. When I was younger, I became a fighter because I had to survive. I had nothing. I had no one to depend on except myself. I realized that boxing was something I was good at, and I trained hard so that I could keep myself and my family alive." In July 2017, after his controversial defeat to [[Jeff Horn]], Pacquiao said: "I love this sport and until the passion is gone, I will continue to fight for God, my family, my fans and my country."{{cite news|title=Manny Pacquiao: Jeff Horn defeat will not stop legend fighting|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/boxing/40579411|publisher=BBC|date=12 July 2017}} As of July 2018, he is the current [[List of WBA world champions#Welterweight|WBA (Regular) welterweight champion]]. In October 2018, Pacquiao signed with [[Al Haymon]].{{cite web |title=Al Haymon and Manny Pacquiao Link Up Shows Haymon Still As Influential As Ever |url=https://www.boxingnewsandviews.com/2018/10/16/al-haymon-and-manny-pacquiao-link-up-shows-haymon-still-as-influential-as-ever/ |website=BoxingNewsandViews.com |accessdate=October 16, 2018 |date=16 October 2018}} ==Basketball career== {{Infobox basketball biography | name = Manny Pacquiao | image = Manny Pacquiao, Mahindra.jpg | caption = Manny Pacquiao playing for the [[Kia Picanto (PBA team)|Kia Picanto]] | career_no = 17 | position = [[Point guard]] | team = No. 17 - the PBA.{{cite news|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/pacquiao-wont-play-in-untv-cup-pineda/282425/|title=Pacquiao won't play in UNTV Cup – Pineda|publisher=[[The Manila Times]]|last=Ramos|first=Josep T.|date=August 27, 2016|accessdate=August 28, 2016}} In 2017, when Pacquiao's three-year rookie deal as a player with the Picanto expired, the team didn't renew his contract again. Speculations swirled about Pacquiao possibly signing with the [[Blackwater Elite]] after its owner Dioceldo Sy said in an interview that he offered Pacquiao a roster spot and a coaching job. Four weeks later, his coaching contract with the Kia Picanto also expired, effectively making him available in the free agent market both as a coach and a player.{{cite web|last1=Ramos|first1=Gerry|title=Manny Pacquiao parts ways with Kia, stays mum on next PBA step amid offer to join Blackwater|url=http://www.spin.ph/basketball/pba/news/manny-pacquiao-parts-ways-with-kia-stays-mum-on-next-pba-step-amid-offer-to-join-blackwater|website=spin.ph|accessdate=September 22, 2017}} ===Charity Leagues=== ====Senate Defenders (2018-present)==== On September 3, 2018, Pacquiao played for the Senate Defenders team in the [[UNTV Cup]] [[UNTV Cup Season 7|Season 7]]. He scored 14 points in a winning effort for his tournament debut.https://www.foxsports.ph/basketball/903454/manny-pacquiao-to-return-to-the-hardwood-in-untv-cup/https://www.spin.ph/basketball/manny-pacquiao-senate-defenders-untv-cup-jeff-sanders-a1373-20180904{{cite news|url=https://www.untvweb.com/untvcup/?p=15274|title=Game Highlights: Senate Defenders’ Sen. Manny Pacquiao Debut at UNTV Cup|publisher=UNTVweb.com|date=September 13, 2018|accessdate=September 13, 2018}} ===PBA career statistics=== {{PBA player statistics legend}} ''Correct as of February 18, 2018''http://stats.humblebola.com/pba/players/580-Pacquiao-Manny[http://www.pba-online.net/profile/Manny-Pacquiao/583/ Player Profile] at PBA-Online! ====Season-by-season averages==== {{PBA player statistics start}} |- | align=left | {{pbay|2014}} | align=left | [[Kia Picanto (PBA team)|Kia Picanto]] | 4 || 6.1 || .000 || .000 || '''.500''' || .5 || '''.3''' || .0 || .0 || .3 |- | align=left | {{pbay|2015}} | align=left | [[Kia Picanto (PBA team)|Kia Picanto]] | '''5''' || 5.3 || .200 || '''.250''' || '''.500''' || .4 || .2 || .0 || .0 || 1.2 |- | align=left | {{pbay|2016}} | align=left | [[Kia Picanto (PBA team)|Kia Picanto]] | 1 || '''8.6''' || '''.750''' || .000 || .000 || '''1.0''' || .0 || .0 || .0 || '''6.0''' |- |- class="sortbottom" | align=center colspan=2 | Career | 10 || 5.9 || .125 || .125 || .400 || .5 || .2 || .0 || .0 || 1.3 {{End}} ==Political career== [[File:Manny Pacquiao (cropped).jpg|thumb|200px|Manny Pacquiao in [[Silliman University]] in [[Dumaguete]], Philippines]] ===2007 election=== On February 12, 2007, Pacquiao officially announced that he would be running for a seat in the Philippine [[House of Representatives of the Philippines|House of Representatives]] in the [[Philippine general election, 2007|May 2007 legislative election]], aiming to represent the [[Legislative districts of South Cotabato|1st District]] of [[South Cotabato]] province. He would run as the candidate of the [[Liberal Party (Philippines)|Liberal Party]] faction under [[Mayor of Manila|Manila mayor]] [[Lito Atienza]] that had affiliated with the government of President [[Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo]].{{cite web |url=http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleId=384834 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130131082251/http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleId=384834 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=January 31, 2013 |title=Pacquiao to run for Congress |author=Marichu Villanueva |date=February 13, 2007 |work=Philstar.com |publisher=[[Philippine Star]] |accessdate=March 13, 2010 }} Pacquiao, who has himself been known to be supportive of the Arroyo government, said that he was persuaded to run by local officials of General Santos City, who hoped he would act as a bridge between their interests and the national government. But after the Philippine Supreme Court declared null and void all nominations of the Liberal Party faction under Atienza, Pacquiao ran under the [[Kabalikat ng Malayang Pilipino]] (KAMPI), a pro-Arroyo political party. Pacquiao was defeated in the election by incumbent Rep. [[Darlene Antonino-Custodio]] of the [[Nationalist People's Coalition]], who said, "More than anything, I think, people weren't prepared to lose him as their boxing icon."{{cite web |url=http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleId=1269 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120909083830/http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleId=1269 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=September 9, Nationalist People's Coalition }} {{Election box end}} ===2010 election=== On November 21, 2009, Pacquiao confirmed that he would run again for the [[Philippine House of Representatives elections in SOCCSKSARGEN, 2010|congressional seat]], but this time in [[Legislative district of Sarangani|Sarangani]] province, the hometown of his wife Jinkee.{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20091121-237558/Pacquiao-confirms-run-for-congressional-seat |title=Pacquiao confirms run for congressional seat |date=November 21, 2009 |work=Inquirer.net |publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]] |accessdate=March 14, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091124101117/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20091121-237558/Pacquiao-confirms-run-for-congressional-seat |archivedate=November 24, 2009 }} He originally planned to run for congress under his own party, the [[People's Champ Movement]], but has since joined the [[Nacionalista Party]] headed by [[Manny Villar]]. Villar said arrangements were made to accommodate Pacquiao's People's Champ Movement in a coalition with the Nacionalista Party for the [[Philippine general election, 2010|May 2010 elections]] in Sarangani.[https://archive.is/20120909125413/http://www.philstar.com/article.aspx?articleid=525640&publicationsubcategoryid=63 philstar.com, Villar picks Pacquiao as NP bet in Sarangani]. Philstar.com (November 22, 2009). Retrieved on May 19, 2012. On May 13, 2010, Pacquiao was officially proclaimed congressman of the lone district of Sarangani. He scored a landslide victory over the wealthy and politically well-entrenched Chiongbian clan that had been in power in the province for more than thirty years. Pacquiao got 120,052 votes while his opponent for the seat, Roy Chiongbian, got 60,899 votes.{{cite web|url=http://sports.inquirer.net/breakingnews/breakingnews/view/20100514-269945/Pacquiao-proclaimed-congressman |title=Pacquiao proclaimed congressman |date=May 14, 2010 |work=inquirer.net |publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer |accessdate=March 14, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100516101555/http://sports.inquirer.net/breakingnews/breakingnews/view/20100514-269945/Pacquiao-proclaimed-congressman |archivedate=May 16, 2010 }} {{Election box begin no change | title=2010 Philippine House of Representatives election at Sarangani}} {{Election box winning candidate with party link no change| |party = People's Champ Movement |candidate = Manny Pacquiao |votes = 120,052 |percentage = 66.35 |change = }} {{Election box candidate with party link no change| |party = Sarangani Reconciliation and Reformation Organization |candidate = Roy Chiongbian |votes = 60,899 |percentage = 33.65 |change = }} {{Election box valid no change |votes = 180,591 |percentage = 97.57 |change = }} {{Election box invalid no change |votes = 4,499 |percentage = 2.43 |change = }} {{Election box total no change |votes = 180,951 |percentage = 100.00 |change = }} {{Election box gain with party link without swing |winner = People's Champ Movement |loser = Sarangani Reconciliation and Reformation Organization }} {{Election box end}} On June 28, 2010, Pacquiao took his oath of office as congressman before [[Supreme Court of the Philippines|Supreme Court]] [[Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the Philippines|Associate Justice]] [[Antonio Carpio|Antonio T. Carpio]] in the Provincial Capitol of Sarangani in [[Alabel|Municipality of Alabel]]. He announced that he would transfer to President-elect [[Benigno Aquino III|Benigno "Noynoy" Aquino III]]'s Liberal Party from Nacionalista Party as he wanted to ensure the entry of more projects to his province.{{cite web|url=http://www.sunstar.com.ph/network/pacquiao-takes-oath-moves-liberal-party-955-am |title=Pacquiao takes oath, moves to Liberal Party (9:55 a.m.) |date=June 28, 2010 |work=sunstar.com.ph |publisher=Sun.Star Network |accessdate=June 28, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110421033458/http://www.sunstar.com.ph/network/pacquiao-takes-oath-moves-liberal-party-955-am |archivedate=April 21, 2011 }} ===2013 election=== Pacquiao later moved to the [[Partido Demokratiko Pilipino-Lakas ng Bayan]] (PDP-Laban) led by Vice-President [[Jejomar Binay]]. He took his oath on April 16, 2012 in front of PDP-LABAN President and Senator [[Aquilino Pimentel III]] and Secretary-General [[Joey de Venecia]] in preparation for the upcoming [[Philippine general election, 2013|2013 elections]].{{cite web |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/255133/news/nation/pacquiao-bolts-aquino-s-lp-for-binay-s-pdp-laban|title=Pacquiao bolts Aquino's LP for Binay's PDP-Laban|date=April 16, 2012|work=gmanetwork.com|publisher=[[GMA News]]|accessdate=April 17, 2012}} In [[Sarangani local elections, 2013|congressional elections in 2013]] he ran unopposed for his second term as congressman. Additionally, his wife, Jinkee, was also elected as Vice-Governor of Sarangani, while his younger brother, Rogelio was defeated by incumbent Rep. Pedro Acharon of [[Team PNoy]] in second district race in South Cotabato which includes General Santos City. {{Election box begin | title=2013 Philippine House of Representatives election at Sarangani}} {{Election box winning candidate with party link| |party = United Nationalist Alliance |candidate = Manny Pacquiao |votes = 144,926 |percentage = |change = }} {{Election box margin of victory |votes = |percentage = |change = }} {{Election box rejected| |votes = 47,085 |percentage = |change = }} {{Election box turnout |votes = 192,011 |percentage = 100 |change = }} {{Election box hold with party link |winner = United Nationalist Alliance |swing = }} {{Election box end}} ===2016 election=== During the Sarangani's 1st district state of the district address on October 5, 2015, Pacquiao formally declared that he was running for Senator under the [[United Nationalist Alliance]] (UNA) party of Vice President [[Jejomar Binay]].{{cite news|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/politics/elections/2016/108190-pacquiao-running-senator|title=It's official: Pacquiao running for senator|publisher=''[[Rappler]]''|last=Espejo|first=Edwin|date=October 5, 2015|accessdate=February 9, 2016}} On May 19, 2016, Pacquiao was formally proclaimed as one of the winners of Philippine Senate seats by the Commission on Elections. At the proclamation ceremony, an elections commissioner introduced Pacquiao as the people's champion and called out his name in the same slow style that he is introduced in his world-famous bouts, drawing cheers from the audience. Pacquiao garnered more than 16 million votes, landing 7th among 12 new members of the Senate.{{cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/05/19/478699594/boxing-great-manny-pacquiao-wins-senate-seat-in-the-philippines|title=Boxing Great Manny Pacquiao Wins Senate Seat In The Philippines|publisher=NPR.org|last=|first=|date=May 19, 2016|accessdate=August 22, 2016}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left; font-size:95%" |- style="background-color:#FFFF99;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;" |colspan=8| May 9, 2016 Philippine Senate election results |- ! font-weight:bold;" | 12th | [[Leila de Lima]] {{party name with colour|Liberal Party (Philippines)}} | 14,144,070 | 31.55% | May 19, 2016 | June 30, 2016 - June 30, 2022 |} ===Senator 2016-=== As Senator Pacquiao has supported bringing back [[Capital punishment]] in the Philippines.https://www.boxingnewsandviews.com/2018/08/07/pacquiao-explains-why-he-supports-death-penalty/https://news.mb.com.ph/2018/08/04/senate-to-conduct-hearings-on-death-penalty/ ===U.S. political endorsements=== He also has endorsed politicians outside the Philippines, in particular his secondary home country in the [[United States]], as he endorsed [[Nevada]] Senator [[Harry Reid]] and [[California]] Governor [[Jerry Brown]] in November 2010.[http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/sports_blog/2010/11/manny-pacquiao-i-helped-jerry-brown-and-nevadas-harry-reid-win-elections-.html Manny Pacquiao: 'I helped' Jerry Brown and Nevada's Harry Reid win elections – latimes.com]. Latimesblogs.latimes.com (November 3, 2010). Retrieved on July 1, 2012. Pacquiao also endorsed Republican [[Duke Aiona]] for Hawaii governor in 2014.[http://www.kitv.com/news/boxer-manny-pacquiao-endorses-duke-aiona-for-governor/29110356 Boxer Manny Pacquiao endorses Duke Aiona for governor]. KITV (October 14, 2014). Retrieved on October 6, 2015. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141209071937/http://www.kitv.com/news/boxer-manny-pacquiao-endorses-duke-aiona-for-governor/29110356 |date=December 9, 2014 }} ==Acting career== Pacquiao started his acting career as an [[extra (actor)|extra]] in some local films and [[guest appearance]]s on [[ABS–CBN Corporation|ABS-CBN]] shows. In December 2005, Pacquiao took his first lead role in Violett Films' ''Lisensyadong Kamao'' (Licensed Fist).{{cite web|title=Lisensyadong kamao (2005)|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0478701/|publisher=IMDB|accessdate=July 11, 2010}} The movie is titled so because (according to director Tony Bernal), being a boxer, Pacquiao is licensed to use his hands.{{citation needed|date=July 2010}} In 2008, Pacquiao starred with [[Ara Mina]] and [[Valerie Concepcion]] in ''Anak ng Kumander'' (Son of Commander). The movie was not a commercial success and was panned by critics.{{citation needed|date=July 2010}} Pacquiao starred in the superhero/comedy film entitled ''[[Wapakman]]'', which was released on December 25, 2009 as an entry to the [[2009 Metro Manila Film Festival]].[http://www.mb.com.ph/articles/227960/panday-wapakman-may-be-banned-metro-film-fest Manila Bulletin – ''Panday'', ''Wapakman'' May Be Banned from the Metro Film Fest]. Mb.com.ph (November 4, 2009). Retrieved on May 19, 2012. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130723173645/http://www.mb.com.ph/articles/227960/panday-wapakman-may-be-banned-metro-film-fest |date=July 23, 2013 }} Like his previous films, ''Wapakman'' was not commercially successful.{{cite web|title='Wapakman' suffers knockout |url=http://www.mb.com.ph/node/236087/wapakman-take |last=Ramos |first=Neil |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130723173800/http://www.mb.com.ph/node/236087/wapakman-take |archivedate=July 23, 2013 }} Upon the expiration of his contract with ABS-CBN, Pacquiao signed with [[GMA Network]] as an actor in September 2007. On December 17, 2007, he taped his first episode of the networks [[infotainment]] show ''[[Pinoy Records]]''.{{cite web|title=iGMA discovers Manny Pacquiao's Achilles heel|url=http://www.gmanews.tv/story/73203/iGMA-discovers-Manny-Pacquiaos-Achilles-heel|publisher=GMA News}} His other projects with the network included ''[[Totoy Bato]]'' and the sitcom ''[[Show Me Da Manny]]'' in which his mother, Dionisia, also appeared. In 2012, American actor [[Sylvester Stallone]] was reportedly in talks with Pacquiao over co-starring in one of Stallone's future films. The project did not push through as no further updates were given after the initial report.{{cite web|last=Cordero|first=Abac|title=Coming soon: Pacman and Rocky|url=http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?ArticleId=431331&publicationSubCategoryId=63|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120629164506/http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?ArticleId=431331&publicationSubCategoryId=63|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2012-06-29}} In 2011, Pacquiao appeared on ''[[Tosh.0]]'' in which he was paired in a fight with [[Daniel Tosh]]. It resulted in Pacquiao winning in one punch. On May 18, 2012, it was reported that Pacquiao will shoot his first Hollywood film after his June 9 fight with [[Timothy Bradley|Tim Bradley]]. He will play a gangster in this movie that will also feature other fighters and martial artists such as [[Hector Echavarria]], [[Lyoto Machida]], [[Anderson Silva]] and [[Frank Mir]]. Filipino-American [[Rob Schneider]] also confirmed the report in an interview that he'll be working with Pacquiao in a movie. The working title is ''Brass Knuckles'' and will be directed by Erick Geisler.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/article/325099|title=Manny Pacquiao gets role in Hollywood movie with Rob Schneider|work=digitaljournal.com}}[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1430812/fullcredits#cast Brass Knuckles (2013) – Full cast and crew]. Another film, based on Pacquiao's early life in boxing, ''[[Kid Kulafu]]'', was released on April 15, 2015, featuring young actor [[Robert Villar]] as Emmanuel "Manny" Pacquiao. The film dramatizes the life of the Filipino boxing superstar during his childhood.{{cite web|url=https://m.imdb.com/title/tt4061876/|title=Kid Kulafu (2015)|work=IMDb|accessdate=May 2, 2016}} A documentary entitled "Manny", which featured Pacquiao's early life as well as his boxing and political career, was released with [[Liam Neeson]] as the narrator.{{cite news | title = Manny Pacquiao Talks About 'Manny' | newspaper = TheMovieNetwork.com | date = April 14, 2015 | url = http://www.themovienetwork.com/interview/manny-pacquiao-talks-about-manny }} Pacquiao is featured in the boxing video games ''[[Fight Night Round 2]]'', ''[[Fight Night Round 3]]'', ''[[Fight Night Round 4]]'' and ''[[Fight Night Champion]]''. Swimmer [[Miguel Molina (swimmer)|Miguel Molina]], [[2005 Southeast Asian Games]]' Best Male Athlete, yielded the honor to Pacquiao, upon the request of President Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo to the national sports officials on the [[Philippines at the 2008 Summer Olympics]].{{cite news|title=Pacquiao records another first |newspaper=Philippine Daily Inquirer |date=August 9, 2008 |url=http://www.inquirer.net/specialfeatures/ThePacquiaoFiles/view.php?db=1&article=20080809-153590 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130723053324/http://www.inquirer.net/specialfeatures/ThePacquiaoFiles/view.php?db=1&article=20080809-153590 |archivedate=July 23, 2013 }} Various business sectors have solicited Pacquiao's help in endorsing their products through commercial advertisements in print and in broadcast media. Other Notes |- | 2005 | ''[[Fight Night Round 2]]'' | rowspan="7"|Himself | rowspan="4"|Playable fighter |- | 2006 | ''[[Fight Night Round 3]]'' |- | 2009 | ''[[Fight Night Round 4]]'' |- | rowspan="2"|2011 | ''[[Fight Night Champion]]'' |- | ''Pound for Pound'' | Main character - Mobile game |- | 2015 | ''PBA Philippine Slam!'' | Playable player - Mobile game |- | 2017 | ''Real Boxing: Manny Pacquiao'' | Main character - Mobile game |} ==Controversy== ===Tax evasion case=== On November 26, 2013, a few days after Pacquiao's victory over [[Brandon Rios]], the Philippine [[Bureau of Internal Revenue (Philippines)|Bureau of Internal Revenue]] (BIR) issued a freeze order on all of Pacquiao's Philippine bank accounts due to his alleged failure to pay [[Philippine peso|₱]]2.2 billion in taxes for earnings he made in his fights in the United States from 2008 to 2009. A day after the bank account freeze, the BIR also issued an order to freeze all of Pacquiao's Philippine properties, whereupon Pacquiao presented documents to the press showing the income tax for non-resident alien payment by his [[Top Rank|promoter]] to the BIR's US counterpart, the [[Internal Revenue Service]], as well as a letter from [[Bob Arum]].{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/337272/economy/moneyandbanking/pacquiao-shows-us-tax-document-but-bir-says-it-has-no-proof-of-payment|title=Pacquiao shows US tax document but BIR says it has no proof of payment|work=gmanetwork.com}} In April 2017, Pacquiao, now a senator, approached Philippine authorities in an attempt to settle the case. The BIR had maintained that taxes were due even if all taxes had been paid to the IRS in the first place.{{cite web|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/business/04/18/17/pacquiao-says-he-wants-to-end-p22-b-tax-case|title=Pacquaio says he wants to end P2.2-B tax case}} ===Comments on homosexuality and same-sex marriage=== In May 2012, Pacquiao was mistakenly quoted as saying "gay men should be put to death."{{cite web|url=http://bossip.com/586277/hi-hater-manny-pacquiao-believes-that-gays-should-be-put-to-death-43081/|title=Manny Pacquiao says that gay people should be put to death – Bossip|work=Bossip}} Pacquiao did not say those words.{{cite web|url=http://www.laweekly.com/news/update-manny-pacquiao-did-not-say-gay-men-should-be-put-to-death-2388143|title=Update: Manny Pacquiao Did Not Say Gay Men Should Be Put to Death*|author=Dennis Romero|work=L.A. Weekly}} Granville Ampong, the writer who wrote the article containing the Bible verse, said that it was he and not Pacquiao who quoted the verse in his article.{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/258431/sports/boxing/pacquiao-misquoted-on-anti-gay-comments-says-examiner-com-writer|title=Pacquiao misquoted on anti-gay comments, says Examiner.com writer|work=GMA News Online|accessdate=May 2, 2016}} Pacquiao is against [[same-sex marriage]] and quoted as saying "God only expects man and women to be together and to be legally married."{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/05/16/manny-pacquiao-gay-marriage-leviticus-examiner_n_1521747.html|title=Manny Pacquiao Against Same-Sex Marriage But Never Said Gay People 'Must Be Put To Death'|work=The Huffington Post | date=May 16, 2012}} {{cquote|If we approve male on male, female on female (marriage), then man is worse than animal.|author=Part of Manny Pacquiao's stand on same-sex marriage in a video statement by TV5 posted on February 15, 2016.{{cite news|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/interaktv/manny-pacquiaos-stand-on-same-sex-marriage-mas-masahol-pa-sa-hayop-ang-tao|title=Manny Pacquiao's stand on same-sex marriage: 'Mas masahol pa sa hayop ang tao'|publisher=''[[InterAksyon]]''|date=February 15, 2016|accessdate=February 17, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160216224554/http://www.interaksyon.com/interaktv/manny-pacquiaos-stand-on-same-sex-marriage-mas-masahol-pa-sa-hayop-ang-tao|archivedate=February 16, 2016|df=mdy-all}}}} In February 2016, Pacquiao, in a video statement posted by [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]], made a comment on the issue of same-sex marriage. Pacquiao, in vernacular, described people in same-sex marriages as behaving worse than animals because animals generally do not have same-sex mating.{{cite news|url=http://sports.abs-cbn.com/boxing/news/2016/02/16/pacquiao-draws-flak-masahol-pa-sa-hayop-comment-8860|title=Pacquiao draws flak for "masahol pa sa hayop" comment|publisher=''[[ABS-CBN Sports]]''|date=February 16, 2016|accessdate=February 16, 2016}} LGBT celebrities including comedian [[Vice Ganda]], singer [[Aiza Seguerra]], TV host [[Boy Abunda]] and the party-list [[Ladlad]] criticized the statements of the senatorial candidate. Pacquiao later apologized and stated that while, as a Christian, he is still against same-sex marriage, which is against Biblical teachings, and he did not condemn gay people themselves,{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-35585016|title=Philippine boxer Manny Pacquiao apologises for gay slur|work=[[BBC]]|date=February 16, 2016|accessdate=February 16, 2016}} saying that he loves them all and is praying for them.{{cite web|url=http://www.lifesitenews.com/news/boxing-champ-manny-pacquiao-defends-natural-marriage-gets-pummelled-by-west|title=Boxing champ Manny Pacquiao defends natural marriage, gets pummelled by Western press|work=LifeSiteNews|accessdate=May 2, 2016}} [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]] ended their longtime partnership with Pacquiao stating his comments against gay people were abhorrent.{{cite web|last1=Fernandez|first1=Erick|title=Nike Drops Manny Pacquiao Following Anti-Gay Comments|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/nike-manny-pacquiao-anti-gay-comments_us_56c49e12e4b0b40245c8918c|publisher=Huffington Post|accessdate=February 18, 2016}} [[The Grove at Farmers Market]] in [[Los Angeles]] also [[Persona non grata|banned]] Pacquiao from the shopping mall.{{cite news|url=http://www.rappler.com/sports/by-sport/boxing-mma/pacquiao/126323-pacquiao-banned-grove|title=Manny Pacquiao once again banned from The Grove over gay remarks|publisher=''[[Rappler]]''|date=March 18, 2016|accessdate=March 19, 2016}} Towards the end of the video, Pacquiao clarified that he is not condemning gay people. {{cquote|...but I am not Summit Express''|date=February 19, 2016|accessdate=February 19, 2016}}}} ===Disclosure of injury=== It was revealed following [[Floyd Mayweather Jr. vs. Manny Pacquiao|Mayweather vs. Pacquiao]] that Pacquiao had sustained an undisclosed injury to his right shoulder while training, and that while it had healed in time for the fight, he re-injured it during the 4th round. {{as of|2015}}, Pacquiao is currently facing a lawsuit of 5 million dollars filed against him by two fans for failing to disclose the shoulder injury in the lead up to his bout with [[Floyd Mayweather Jr.|Floyd Mayweather]].{{cite web|url=http://www.designntrend.com/articles/49947/20150505/manny-pacquiao-hit-with-5-million-class-action-lawsuit-after-two-fans-say-he-lied-about-his-injury-in-the-mayweather-fight.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150507021746/http://www.designntrend.com/articles/49947/20150505/manny-pacquiao-hit-with-5-million-class-action-lawsuit-after-two-fans-say-he-lied-about-his-injury-in-the-mayweather-fight.htm|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2015-05-07|title=Manny Pacquiao Hit With $5 Million Class-Action Lawsuit After Two Fans Say He Lied About His Injury In The Mayweather Fight|work=Design & Trend}} Pacquiao failed to disclose the injury to the Nevada State Athletic Commission in the pre-fight injury evaluation.{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/watch/cnbc/manny-pacquiao-failed-to-disclose-shoulder-injury-440750659566 |title=Manny Pacquiao faces class action lawsuit |work=NBC News |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518093717/http://www.nbcnews.com/watch/cnbc/manny-pacquiao-failed-to-disclose-shoulder-injury-440750659566 |archivedate=May 18, 2015 }}{{cite news| url=http://www.nydailynews.com/sports/more-sports/pacquiao-failure-disclose-injury-perjury-article-1.2210373 | location=New York | work=Daily News | title=Pacquiao's failure to reveal injury may bring perjury charge | date=May 5, 2015}} The commission did a standard injury report with Pacquiao filling out the form saying that he had no injuries heading into the bout. Pacquiao said he had sustained the injury weeks out from the fight against Mayweather. However, after the lawsuit from the two fans was filed against him, Pacquiao has since said that he sustained the injury during the fight in which it flared up in the 3rd round.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/sport/boxing/article4431663.ece|title=Nevada State stance rubs salt into Pacquiao's wound|work=The Times}} The Nevada State Athletic Commission stated at the post fight press conference that they had only just found out about Pacquiao's injury that evening at the post fight press conference. Speculation arose that the injury was an excuse for the loss to Mayweather because Pacquiao did not mention an injury in the post fight interview with [[Max Kellerman]].
